body:
## Expected Behavior

Sets up schema

```
bash-5.0# env | grep SQL
SQL_TLS=true
SQL_TLS_ENABLED=true
bash-5.0# export SQL_TLS_DISABLE_HOST_VERIFICATION=true
bash-5.0# export SQL_HOST_VERIFICATION=false
bash-5.0# ./temporal-sql-tool setup-schema -v 0.0
```

## Actual Behavior

Fails without a client cert, despite my server not needing or desiring a client cert, but it **does** require TLS.

```
bash-5.0# env | grep SQL
SQL_TLS=true
SQL_TLS_ENABLED=true
bash-5.0# export SQL_TLS_DISABLE_HOST_VERIFICATION=true
bash-5.0# export SQL_HOST_VERIFICATION=false
bash-5.0# ./temporal-sql-tool setup-schema -v 0.0
2025/10/25 01:19:33 Config Error:Config Error:must provide tls certs to use
```
## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

1. Run `temporalio/admin-tools:1.4.1` with other env vars set to configure your database (in this case postgres)
2. Repeat above
3. See failure

## Specifications

  - Version: `temporalio/admin-tools:1.4.1`
  - Platform: kubernetes

comments.body: Not an issue with the latest tag `temporalio/admin-tools:1.29.0-tctl-1.18.4-cli-1.4.2`, sorry for the noise.

title: temporal-sql-tool can't be run with TLS enabled without client certs
